channel.title: Connection/hosting problem...(SOMEONE WHO USES ROUTER TO HOST I NEED UR HELP)
channel.description:
Ok before I start, I made like 2 more threads this week about this problem I've been trying to solve and beileve me I tried almost everything so yeah I'm sorry if I been annoying with all these threads but I really wish to get this solved this is the last time i'm trying if I get no help I won't bother to try again.
So i'm trying to host a server for my friends to join it and I have a weird problem, sometimes i'm not able to connect, neither can my friends from their home (they use wireless router and so do i) and sometimes I can connect but they still can't, they can only connect if they use my router's internet when they're at my house and when they try to connect from their internet it just says error connecting to server and yes my server is on when they try to connect.
Now what I need to know from anyone who uses router to host how do you do it? or could I be doing something wrong? I'll show some pictures and see if you can find something wrong...
The ip in client, .Gui: [URL=http://img138.imageshack.us/i/86502611.jpg/][IMG]http://img138.imageshack.us/img138/2721/86502611.jpg[/img][/URL] No-ip Client: [URL=http://img18.imageshack.us/i/95200931.jpg/][IMG]http://img18.imageshack.us/img18/5884/95200931.jpg[/img][/URL] Port Forwarding: [URL=http://img80.imageshack.us/i/432p.jpg/][IMG]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8113/432p.jpg[/img][/URL] [size=8pt]Yes, I did use the port checker it says both ports, 43594 and 5555 are open that means I portforwarded right.[/size] FTP: [URL=http://img52.imageshack.us/i/53238744.jpg/][IMG]http://img52.imageshack.us/img52/1634/53238744.jpg[/img][/URL]
That's about everything and yes I did add the ports in the firewall exceptions
After all that still nothing I don't get it!! :S

item.title: Connection/hosting problem...(SOMEONE WHO USES ROUTER TO HOST I NEED UR HELP)
item.dc:creator: @killercam killercam
item.description:
@killercam wrote:

Did you setup a static ip? Im sure you did but just double checking.
Are you sure you got your ip right?

Read full topic

item.source: Connection/hosting problem...(SOMEONE WHO USES ROUTER TO HOST I NEED UR HELP)

item.title: Connection/hosting problem...(SOMEONE WHO USES ROUTER TO HOST I NEED UR HELP)
item.dc:creator: @fallen_angel666 fallen_angel666
item.description:
@fallen_angel666 wrote:

[quote=“Dead Inside, post:5, topic:343872”]I did what you said, made a tcp and udp forward and made an ftp server for tcp and udp with the ports 5555 and 43594, but it still says error connecting for me don’t know for my friends, I have to go now, tomorrow i’ll ask one of my mate’s to try and login and also restart the comp maybe it will take effect if I restart.
Thanks for your help ;]

[size=12pt]EDIT:[/size]
Ok I reset my comp, but still it didn’t connect…so I doubt if any of my friends can connect…any other suggestions?[/quote]
hm… Im not too familiar with cnet, but it sounds like everything should be working fine.
Make sure the ip in the portforward box is the same as your default ip on your router.

Read full topic
item.source: Connection/hosting problem...(SOMEONE WHO USES ROUTER TO HOST I NEED UR HELP)

item.title: Connection/hosting problem...(SOMEONE WHO USES ROUTER TO HOST I NEED UR HELP)
item.dc:creator: @Dead_Inside Dead Inside
item.description:
@Dead_Inside wrote:

I did what you said, made a tcp and udp forward and made an ftp server for tcp and udp with the ports 5555 and 43594, but it still says error connecting for me don’t know for my friends, I have to go now, tomorrow i’ll ask one of my mate’s to try and login and also restart the comp maybe it will take effect if I restart.
Thanks for your help ;]

[size=12pt]EDIT:[/size]
Ok I reset my comp, but still it didn’t connect…so I doubt if any of my friends can connect…any other suggestions?

Read full topic
item.source: Connection/hosting problem...(SOMEONE WHO USES ROUTER TO HOST I NEED UR HELP)

item.title: Connection/hosting problem...(SOMEONE WHO USES ROUTER TO HOST I NEED UR HELP)
item.dc:creator: @fallen_angel666 fallen_angel666
item.description:
@fallen_angel666 wrote:

Dead Inside:

Cnet cwr-854

-if you didn’t just add that port forwarding picture, please read ahead-
Sorry, I didn’t even see that picture facepalm
-if you did just add that picture, Ignore the text above-
I think I see where you went wrong

  1. create a second port forward with the same ip, but select UDP.
  2. change the “both” into TCP.
  3. make a FTP server 2 (in the last picture) and select UDP.
    Tell me if it worked.

Read full topic
